response.name: Bacon and Egg Breakfast Casserole
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
2. Cut bacon into 1 inch pieces and fry until crisp. Drain on paper towels.
3. Beat together eggs, milk, salt, pepper, mustard, and Worcestershire sauce.
4. Spread bacon in the bottom of the dish. Pour egg mixture over bacon. Sprinkle with cheese.
5. Bake for 30 to 45 minutes, until set.

response.name: Pancake Breakfast Casserole
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
2. In a large skillet, cook sausage over medium heat until browned. Drain fat and set sausage aside.
3. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, milk, salt, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Stir in eggs and mix until well blended.
4. Melt butter in the same skillet you used to cook the sausage. Stir in sugar and vanilla extract. Add apples and blueberries and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Pour the fruit mixture into the prepared baking dish. Top with the cooked sausage.
6. Pour the batter over the top of the casserole. Bake for 45 minutes, or until the pancake casserole is golden brown and cooked through.

response.name: Scrambled Eggs
instructions: 1. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk.

2. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the egg mixture and cook, stirring occasionally, until the eggs are scrambled and cooked to your liking. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Serve the scrambled eggs with toast and your favorite breakfast sides. Enjoy!

response.name: Pancake Breakfast Casserole
ingredients: 1 (16 oz) package frozen shredded hash brown potatoes
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
2. In a large skillet, cook sausage over medium heat until browned; drain.
3. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper. Stir in milk and eggs until well blended. Stir in melted butter.
4. Spread batter into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with sausage, cheese, and frozen potatoes.
5. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until pancakes are golden brown and potatoes are cooked through. Serve hot.
